job_description:
Make is seeking a full-time Frontend Engineer (or Fullstack) to craft large-scale software. Beyond problem solving and pull requests, it’s important for this person to effectively communicate and have a genuine enthusiasm for software!

Our team is passionate about creating world-class software (like this) and we want you to make us even better. If this sounds like it might fit what you’re looking for too, read on, and get in touch.

Manager of One
We rely on everyone at Make to do a lot of self-management and take initiative. People who do this well are ‘managers of one,’ and we strive for everyone to fully embody this principle. That means setting your own direction when one isn't given. Determining what needs to be done, and doing it, without waiting for someone to tell you to. A good way to answer this is be asking which of the following helps you thrive in your work:

I thrive when given detailed tasks of what to do, how to do them and when to do them
I thrive when given requirements + priorities...and prefer to self-manage my tasks

A Passion For Solving Problems
Our clients have real businesses, real customers, real opportunities and real pain points. We quickly learn their product and internal workings. Our customers view us as trusted advisors and thought leaders. This role materially shapes the products, platforms and features that our award-winning team will produce.

About Make (letsMake.com)
Make is a highly personable design and engineering agency based in Texas and with team members worldwide. We’re passionate about creating world-class software that people enjoy using. We’re a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, designers and other great folks. Our work has been featured in Techcrunch, Mashable, US Weekly, CBS News, Texas Monthly and The Today Show. We’re proud to have a portfolio of work that viewed by millions of people every week and that’s been featured 25+ times in the Apple App Store and Google Play. At the end of the day, we view this as our life’s work and not more than our work life.

Culture + Remote Work
We’re not only passionate about our craft but also about our culture. We deeply believe that work is purposeful and that culture is one of the most important parts of any team.

Outcomes
Successfully code large-scale frontends based on an atomic design system
Write thoughtful code that helps real-world needs
Collaborate with a remote team of engineers to ship sizable software

Start Window: April - May 15 2023

Employment: Full-time (contract)
Communication Requirements: Must (1) have good communication skills, (2) fluent in English, (3) and be available for video calls during the workday.


Required Technical Experience
5+ years minimum experience frontend development of custom software solutions
2+ years react

3+ years experience working with fronted technologies such as React.js, Next.js, Javascript, Tailwind, Typescript, etc.
Built or playing a significant role in building 2+ large scale software projects

We provide primary care, specialty care, urgent care, emergency care, community health services, foster and adoption services, child and family counseling, child advocacy services and family resource centers. Our reputation draws patients and families from around the country.
We offer a wide variety of rewarding career opportunities and are seeking individuals dedicated to helping us achieve our vision of the healthiest kids in the country. If you want to work for an organization that makes a difference for children and families, and encourages you to be at your best every day, please apply today.

You walk into the old, dimly lit diner after a long day of job searching. You hear a small group of people in a corner booth talking to each other, but your ear picks up on phrases such as "mid range dev", "programmer", and "database" which catches your attention. You happen to catch a glance from one of the older looking of the group and he motions you to come over. Unsure on why you were singled out, you hesitantly make your way to the table. It takes you a minute, but as you stand near the group you begin to understand better what they're talking about.

"We just need someone that knows how to put their head down and throw down some decent code," a taller male with short hair says. Someone mentioned his name was Ty earlier; you mentally note that and continue to listen, "We have too much to program and not enough developers."

"Well the ideal person can't be a junior dev cause we're looking for someone with decent PHP experience, but I think we could hire someone if they had some decent personal experience. We need someone to hit the ground running so to speak. They don't necessarily need to be familiar with a particular PHP framework, but I guess it wouldn't hurt if they did. Heck they could be familiar with Python, Ruby, or Java for all I care as long as they know what they're doing! Oh, and they'll definitely have to know how to work with MySQL too!" a lady says as she sips on her Italian soda. "There's a lot of programmers out there and they've only worked on dinky little projects and they have no idea how to work with something substantial."

"Most of 'em don't even know what an index is in a database!" Ty blurted out and laughed to himself. "You remember that guy that dropped the users table and thought drop was the move command?! They think that because they know some HTML, CSS, and jQuery that they can build anything on their own. I love watching the light fade from their eyes as their precious creation gets destroyed by my friends scale and load," he says as he menacingly clenches his fist in playful fury.

Charlotte, the waitress, passes behind you writing something down on a small pad. You say hi and she smiles and asks, "The usual for you?"

"Yeah, sounds good thanks," you smile and then turn your head back towards the conversation.

"Do they have to have a CS degree or do you think experience we'll be enough?" the lady you've figured out is Rachel asks the group.

"Ehh, it'll depend on how the interview goes. A degree is cool, but you could still be a bonehead at understanding coding concepts and waste a lot of our time. The last guy we hired burned us pretty good pulling that 'degree' card," Ty replied and continued, "I bet if we hired a senior dev they'd just be bossing us around and telling us everything we're doing is wrong! A senior will just slow us down for their 'revolutionary coding ideas'."

You notice the older one who motioned you over has been silent for most of the conversation. His fingers are interlocked in front of his face and he is quietly moving his head from one speaker to the next.

"We have a decent benefits package to offer whoever we hire. Medical, dental, vision, a decent amount of PTO and even a little benefits stipend to split up between wherever. The last I checked with the programmers, they said they had learning opportunities galore with all the unique problems they get to solve in the code bases. We pay our programmers well too..." Rachel says to no one in particular. After a moment she looks at another lady and discreetly comments, "Well a senior dev could work as long as they weren't so full of themselves and realized the world revolves around the sun and not them." The other lady quietly laughed while Ty was distracted giving his order to the waitress.

"Are you ok if they work remote?" Ty asks another lady.

"Yeah remote is fine with me as long as they are performing well. I know their manager hates micromanaging every little move their programmers make," the lady replies back.

It conversation lulls for a moment and you feel a swell of courage rise up from inside you. This is the perfect opportunity you've literally been searching for for weeks! You feel the words coming together inside your head and right before they come out, Ty notices you and turns to the older guy that originally motioned you over.

"Why'd you bring them over Ron?" he subtly chides Ron while pointing at you. "You think some rando walking into this place is who we're looking for?"

Ron slowly brings his head up and adjusts his body in the chair to better face you. He kindly smiles and asks you, "Yeah, I do actually. I think this one is different. You wanna apply and see what happens?"

job_title: Research Software Engineer - Efficient Large Language Models
job_description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Are you excited about the latest advances in Large Language Models? Are you interested in advancing efficiency of large language models, publishing your work in the most prestigious AI conferences in the world, and making your code open source? How about working closely with top-notch MIT faculty, students, and IBM scientists in a flexible and fun environment? Are you passionate about opportunities to bridge your scientific work to real-world impact? If you answered yes to these questions, then you should apply to our research software engineer position at IBM Research. We are seeking a talented and highly motivated engineer with background in natural language processing to join our team. You will be responsible to conduct cutting-edge research on efficient training and inference of large language models, developing prototype solutions to real-world problems, and publishing papers in top-quality conferences. We believe efficiency is key to enable state-of-the-art language models work on a variety of devices, make a real impact in the world and bring research to practice.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Hands-on experience in natural language processing and deep learning
Strong programming and software engineering skills
Great problem solving skills, with a strong desire for quality and engineering excellence
Ability to quickly prototype ideas and use creative approaches for solving complex problems


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Publications in top AI conferences
Experience with training and inference of language models for key NLP tasks

About Business Unit
IBM Research is the organic growth engine of IBM and an innovation engine for our customers and partners. As part of this mission, IBM Research anticipates and examines 'What's Next in Computing' to ultimately create and integrate the technologies the world relies upon to solve big challenges and unlock new opportunities. We create and pioneer new markets for IBM, our partners and customers as exemplified in our ongoing quest to reach practical and large-scale quantum computing. Across IBM Research, we realize the power and potential to accelerate discovery with our partners and clients by combining the power of high performance computing, AI, and Quantum, all integrated through the hybrid cloud.
This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.

Your Life @ IBM
In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
Are you ready to be an IBMer?

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM offers a competitive benefits program which may include medical & prescription drug coverage, dental, vision, mental health & well being, 8 paid holidays, minimum 56 hours paid sick time, 80 hours paid vacation, life insurance, 401(k), financial counseling, and the IBM Employee Stock Purchase Plan. IBM offers paid family medical leave and disability benefits to eligible employees where required by applicable law.

The compensation range and benefits for this position are based on a full-time schedule for a full calendar year. The salary will vary depending on your job-related skills, experience and location. Pay increment and frequency of pay will be in accordance with employment classification and applicable laws. For part time roles, your compensation and benefits will be adjusted to reflect your hours. Benefits may be pro-rated for those who start working during the calendar year.

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

job_title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER - APPLE SUPPORT - EPIC SECURE CHAT - 8371
job_description:
Montefiore, the University Hospital for Albert Einstein College of Medicine, is one of healthcare’s most wired hospitals. Our experts deploy new technologies, define new business processes and provide stakeholders across the institution with the resources needed to meet their most difficult challenges. As a Montefiore IT employee, your work will be part of our mission to improve healthcare through information technology.

Our Apple Product Support and Development team is seeking a Software Engineer. This newly created position will be a part of Montefiore’s initiative to launch the Epic Secure Chat module, an integrated asynchronous text-based system available within Epic products Haiku, Canto, Rover and Hyperspace for user-to-user communication. In this role, the candidate will need to possess first-rate skills in supporting Apple iOS, iPadOS and macOS products, understand how the Apple product line interacts with and is managed by a variety of MDM solutions (JAMF, InTune and MaaS360) and have a strong understanding of Windows in an enterprise environment. The candidate will be responsible for becoming the subject matter expert on the configuration and setup of Epic Rover mobile application on Apple iOS products.

Responsibilities include:
Become subject matter expert on configuration and setup of Epic Rover iOS mobile application.
Participate in projects and processes for large-scale deployments of new hardware and new technologies.
Provide day-to-day support for Apple Hardware and Software in the environment based on the team’s support queue, including remote, on-site, and executive level support.
Work closely with Level 2 support on escalated incidents.
Support the Technical and Team Leads in building and maintaining Apple support architecture.
Assist with new solutions and modifications in test environments of MDM’s.
Document team processes and team architecture.
Document recurring issues into knowledgebase and notate casework.
Resolve issues through testing and troubleshooting, leveraging vendor support, and consulting with other internal technical teams.
Proactively analyze systems and distinguish non-routine issues in order to create custom solutions.
Maintain a high level of technical expertise and business knowledge, particularly with Apple products.

Requirements include:
Strong experience providing Apple-related IT support, including an enterprise Windows environment.
In-depth knowledge in all Apple hardware and software. Expert knowledge of Apple iOS, iPadOS and macOS products.
Skilled in Mobile Device Management core concepts.
Experience with large scale iOS deployment, implementations and MDM migrations.
Capable in supporting Office for Mac product line.
Adept with macOS package management.
Understanding of Windows environments, computer networking and Active Directory.
Must have clear communication skills, both oral and written.
Ability to communicate the needs of users to staff in other IT departments, while interpreting Apple hardware requirements.
Ability to prioritize and demonstrate organization amid rapid and frequent changes.
Detail oriented and mindful about following through with tasks and projects.
Excellent customer service skills with a natural ability to liaise with executive staff.
Ability to maintain, track, and report project status and metrics.
Candidate should be able to prepare documentation and keep the operations area informed of changes to the production environment.

Desired:
Apple Certified Support Professional
JAMF and InTune MDM Certification

This job requisition is for a software engineering position with Lockheed Martin-both the largest defense contractor in the world and a renowned global leader in technological innovation.

Lockheed Martin is seeking an entry level software engineer to join the Agile software development team in support of electronic warfare systems on the B-2 advanced stealth bomber.

This position requires a self-motivated individual with a positive attitude, strong work ethic, and the technical ability to diagnose and solution complex software challenges in a collaborative team-based environment consisting of software, systems, and test engineers.

This individual will be responsible for producing quality software deliverables, ensuring system requirements are translated into a software design consistent with overall software architecture, and that the implementation satisfies requirements.

Daily activities typically include requirements analysis, software design, algorithm development, coding, version control, technical documentation, peer review, test design, testing, data analysis, debugging, technical troubleshooting, and issue documentation.

Selected applicant is subject to a government security background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information required for this position.

Ability to obtain DoD Security Clearance (US citizenship required)
Strong work ethic, positive attitude, & team-oriented
Strong analytical, problem-solving, & technical troubleshooting skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong programming skills and ability to learn new languages
Computer Science or Software Engineering related bachelor’s degree
Desired Skills:
Ability to obtain DoD Security Clearance (US citizenship required)
Strong work ethic, positive attitude, & team-oriented
Strong analytical, problem-solving, & technical troubleshooting skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong programming skills and ability to learn new languages
Computer Science or Software Engineering related bachelor’s degree

Clearance Level: Secret

Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.

These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.

Challenge customer’s approach and recommend a better value engineered project approach and a differentiated technical solution in collaboration with Sales. Provide bid phase technical expertise transparent to the customer. Participate in customer site visits for job walks, interviews, or meetings (in-person or remotely)
Focus on design (not estimation), and investigate, price, and appropriately scope viable product substitutions to meet performance specifications. Also, will calculate, understand, and communicate product, installation, and commissioning risk factors before and during cost reviews. Leverage centralized estimating resources while simplifying portions of scope that require special definition. Develop sequence of operations. Influence product selection (including 3rd party products)
Understand organization of master format specification and identify 3rd party integration requirements Comply with customer and code requirements.
Coordinate the estimating effort of centralized Estimators and develop a scope of work and executive summary for use by the estimator. Align with local operations team during cost review and technical handover meetings. Assist sales executives in communication with customers and/or estimators
Develop pre-construction services proposals. Differentiate Siemens from the competition with innovative proposals. Participate in proposal evaluation meetings
Large project bid management and bid day team as vital to build appropriate solution

A Minimum of 3 years of Security systems successful experience and with proven competencies in Access Control, Video Surveillance, and Intrusion systems and devices; 7 years preferred
High School Diploma or GED; Bachelor’s degree in mechanical or the Electrical field preferred

Proven ability to design Security System Integration into other Building Systems (e.g., Fire, Automation, HR Data Systems)

Proven knowledge of building codes and regulations and Knowledge of building construction process

This position develops custom solutions to enhance functionality of applications and meet unique customer needs. Employee should be comfortable developing plugins, themes, custom post types, WordPress CLI scripts, and other WordPress CMS solutions based on project requirements. This position is responsible for assessing and triaging bugs and enhancements through GitHub as well as participating in all stages of development, testing, implementation, and maintenance. This position will work with standard web interfaces (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and a full application stack consisting of server OS, web server (IIS and Apache), programming and scripting (PHP, Python), and database (MySQL and MSSQL).

The position will serve as team lead for our other developers. The team lead will manage projects, provide code reviews, review documentation and procedures, application administration

This position is responsible for advanced troubleshooting and support, and developing enhancements for various enterprise web applications. Additionally, this position offers advanced technical expertise to consultants and clients for enterprise applications in a wide variety of areas which requires an overall understanding of the ECU technology infrastructure. Employee will assist with determining the best solutions for campus users to meet their needs.

This position helps in the selection of applications and creation of standards and guidelines for its proper use and configuration to meet the needs of customers. Employee is responsible for creating tools using vendor APIs and web services to extend application functionality for our users. In addition, this position is responsible for data management from outside resources importing into a variety of enterprise applications. Employee serves as an expert in the use of these applications and should keep up to date on application upgrades and new features.

This position should stay up to date on new technologies, best practices, and modern development methods. Employee will communicate regularly with peers using chat, audio, and video.

This position may be eligible for Flexible Work Arrangements (FWA) under the ECU FWA Policy.

Employees are required to adjust their standard work schedule to meet the requirements of their position, which includes and not limited to evening and weekend hours to perform scheduled and unscheduled workload requirements to maintain University operations.

Minimum Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree and 4 years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.

License or Certification Required by Statute or Regulation
n/a

Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education
Experience with all phases in development process with preference given to Agile Methodologies
Experience with the following environments, languages, and tools: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, MySQL, MVC framework, REST APIs, Git/GitHub, WordPress, React JS, and cloud platform services (Google, AWS)
Knowledge of web accessibility standards (WCAG), responsive design, and Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Experience configuring and updating continuous integration pipelines
Maintain and update documentation
Collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders to gather and explain business requirements
Ability to continually learn new technologies and mentor team members, troubleshoot complex issues, manage projects with multiple contributors
Strong written and verbal communication skills

BASIC FUNCTIONS: This position performs complex research, design, and software development assignments within a software functional area or product line, and provides direct input to project plans, schedules, and methodology in the development of cross-functional software products. This position performs software design — typically across multiple systems; mentors more-junior members of the team; and talks to users/customers and translates their requests into solutions.

QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years of Software Engineering experience
BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required

TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Advanced knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall).
Strong proficiency with data manipulation language including optimization techniques.
Strong understanding of normalized/dimensional data modeling principles.
Strong knowledge of multiple data storage subsystems.
Expertise in development languages including but not limited to: Java/J2EE, JavaScript, JSP, C/C++, HTML, XML, SQL, Windows, UNIX, and .Net.
Strong research skills.
Strong knowledge in industry best practices in development.
Knowledge in using and developing applicable tool sets.
Ability to interface competently with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.
Ability to work well with internal and external technology resources.
Knowledge of test-driven development.
Ability to write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of complex system components.
Ability to complete complex bug fixes.
Good oral and written communications skills.

ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Interface with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.
Write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of complex system components.
Complete complex bug fixes.
Work closely with other development team members to understand complex product requirements and translate them into software designs.
Successfully implement development processes, coding best practices, and code reviews.
Operate in various development environments (Agile, Waterfall, etc.) while collaborating with key stakeholders.
Resolve complex technical issues as necessary.
Train entry-level software engineers as directed by department management, ensuring they are knowledgeable in critical aspects of their roles.
Keep abreast of new technology developments.
Design and work with complex data models.
Mentor less-senior software developers on development methodologies and optimization techniques.
All other duties as assigned.

FULL TIME
At DraftKings, we're inspired by our shared passion for developing creative solutions to complex challenges and empowering the people around us to do their best work. We are industry leaders in the digital entertainment and technology space and are propelled by constant curiosity and diverse perspectives.
GET YOUR START AT A GROUNDBREAKING COMPANY.
Our engineering division is composed of many tight-knit and stable teams that each own a specific area of our platform all the way from the UI to the database. You will be assigned directly to one of these teams and will work alongside senior engineers responsible for bringing you up to speed. We will value your ability to work closely with a group of your peers to achieve meaningful results and can offer an excellent platform for starting your career in engineering.
WHAT YOU’LL DO AS A SOFTWARE ENGINEER:
You will be developing systems and APIs that power a rich set of applications used by a large and passionate group of users every day.
Care about agility as much as you care about scalability. We roll out products very quickly and are looking for a team that can pivot at a moment’s notice.
Triage and debug software application issues.
Work with modern technologies on scalable, reliable systems that people use in a 24/7 sports betting market.
Contribute to production code immediately.
WHAT YOU’LL BRING:
Experience across multiple courses where writing software is a primary element.
Hands-on experience with Git in a shared repository.
Comfort in picking up new languages and technologies quickly.
Exposure to object-oriented languages (e.g. Swift, Kotlin, Java, C#).
Collaborative, team-based implementation, either in an internship or project setting.
Experience writing unit tests.

Summary
Posted: Nov 18, 2022
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number: 200443043
The Tools Productivity team is developing tooling and services to ensure Apple's OS platforms and Apps are amazing to use on iPhone, iPad, Mac, Watch, TV, and beyond. Our tools are a crucial part of Apple's development workflow and our services enable running tests at an extensive scale as part of the At-desk and CI workflows of Apple's engineers. This team is growing the scope and scale of testing that is possible at Apple by building tools and solutions for physical and virtual workflows and is looking for people excited by that goal.
Key Qualifications
Strong coding skills (preferably, but not necessarily in Swift)
Desire to design, build, and support tools and services for testing software at scale
Familiarity with git or other source control systems.
Knowledge of Computer Science concepts (e.g. using efficient data structures and algorithms, memory management)
Familiarity with basic operating system concepts (e.g. manipulating files, managing processes)
Description
As a member of the internal tools productivity team, you will contribute to a dynamic full-stack development team. You will use Swift to create powerful command line tools, flexible frameworks, and high scale web services. You will work on features to accelerate the adoption of Xcode Cloud inside and outside of Apple. You will help to design and develop new tools and services to enable seamless test authoring, sharing, and execution for Apple's engineering teams as they scale their testing using Xcode Cloud. You will create novel solutions to meet the unique needs of testing at the speed and scale, and diversity of use cases in Apple's software organization. This could look like minimizing the overhead of test setup and result reporting so users get their results in seconds not minutes, supporting new types of test targets, adding new extension points and APIs for teams to customize their tests, or ensuring our tooling integrates seamlessly with Xcode at-desk and in the Cloud.
Education & Experience
Bachelor in Computer Science or Equivalent experience
Additional Requirements
Pay & Benefits
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $150,000 and $230,000, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.
